reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for only a night in early July, 2010, on our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Excellent little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was very good, offering help on locating points of interest and all the usual jive. The room was clean and comfortable in size, and the bathroom was actually quite a bit larger than I anticipated. The only beef I had with the room were the super thin walls - we got to bed around 11pm that night, and there must have been a gentleman in the room next to us snoring super loud, sounding like he was in the room with us. We had to sleep with our headphones on (felt like our hostels!). Other than that they were good.
reviews.title: Could not be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We skipped the breakfast, so we can't comment on that. Looks like they had some fruit, yogurt, bread, and OJ/tea/coffee available though. The location was fantastic - a mere 5 minute stroll to St. Mark's Square and the nearest taxi stop. The instructions they give for reaching the hotel are a big confusing - we had to rely on the map we brought at the train station that had more detailed street information. Still not too hard to find, but be aware.
reviews.title: Couldn't Ask for More

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Wifi was 6 euros/hour, or 12 euros for a 24 hour period. Knowing we wanted to Skype home that night, we did the 24 hour dealie and it worked out well.
reviews.title: Best Value in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price, location, and service, I'd recommend these guys. There's lots of other highly rated hotels in Venice around the same price and location though, so don't be afraid to shop around. There seems to be more competition there than many other cities we stopped in.
reviews.title: Marvelous small friendly hotel in a superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a B&B with 6 rooms. The service here was great, some of the best I've received anywhere. The reception and breakfast staff were very helpful and friendly. E.g. We had to check out early, prior to when breakfast would ordinarily be served, so the B&B organised an early breakfast for us. The location is good, it's very close to San Marco square, the big tourist spot in Venice, but I found it was still quiet enough so sleeping was never a problem. Whilst the decor and furnishings in the room were old, the room was large and comfortable. The only real negative thing about the place was that the shower cubicle was very small. The other thing is that noise within the B&B carries somewhat, so you can hear other guests walking around in their rooms. The other guests staying at the time of our stay were not noisey so this wasn't a problem for us, but it could conceivably be if you had bad neighbours. Overall I would recommend this B&B, and would stay here again myself.
reviews.title: Good location & excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were here in July 2010 for 3 nights. The room was not large, but it was clean and very comfortable. The people were extremely nice and helpful. The breakfast was simple, but thoughtfully prepared and done well. The best part is the location, only a minute from San Marco and a few more minutes from the Rialto on a small square. We really did not have any complaints, except have to pay for WiFi. This a good deal, solid B&B in the heart of Venice.
reviews.title: Great Home Base for Exploring Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are very satisfied of the service in the hotel. The staff was very helpfull and friendly. The room was perfectly clean. The location is wonderfull in quiet square near St.Mark's. We had breakfast outside that was a good start of our days in Venice. We will recommend Casa Querini to our friends. We hope one day return to Venice and Casa Querini.
reviews.title: Wonderfull place with perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was the first time I have stayed in an inn. The staff was very kind, and even moved up our breakfast time to help us with our train schedule. The location is perfect with a quick walk to St. Mark's, yet this hotel is hidden enough where it is quiet and not tourist-ridden. I would stay here again anytime especially for the price!
reviews.title: Great location and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierges are very helpful, especially the night porter, Edison. For example, the tv in our room could not receive the channel broadcasting the world cup soccer, so the night porter replaced the tv with one from a vacant room. The hotel is very clean, but the room and the bath are both small and the shower water flow was weak and the water temperature varied. Breakfast (which is mediocre) is served in a cramped room, but there are a few tables outside the hotel entrance in a small square with little pedestrian traffic.
reviews.title: An excellent location near St. Marks square, easy to find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights and were very pleased. The rooms are quite large, very unusual for a European hotel. The staff speaks enough English that we had no trouble communicating with them. For Venice, I found the price to be a great value. They do want you to pay in cash which it states on their website. An adequate breakfast is served and they are very accommodating if you have to leave early. The hotel is located in a very quiet Piazza and you can have breakfast outside if you wish. Unfortunately, it was raining so we couldn't sit outside at breakfast or after our day of sight seeing. However, after returning from dinner one night they opened the breakfast room up for us so we could sit with our friends and discuss our day and plan the next. The night desk clerk even offered to make us coffee if we wanted. So much nicer than all of us sitting in one of our rooms. It is also a short walk to San Marco Square and an easy walk to the Rialto. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Very quiet, very clean, friendly staff, large rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week based on a Steves' recommendation and was not disappointed!
reviews.title: Great Choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest positive for this pensione is location. It's 5-10 minutes from the nearest vaporetto stop, and 5-10 minutes from St. Mark's. As others have stated it's on a quiet square so noise should not be an issue, however we had noise issues simply because we were there over an extremely busy weekend (the regatta weekend). So no fault to the hotel on the noise issue and I imagine that on pretty much any other week you'd be just fine.
reviews.title: Ahhh...a quiet room in Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was kind of small, but what I would expect from a pensione like this in Europe. The room & bath were kept extremely clean and there were no plumbing or hot water problems. We had #12 overlooking the square that could be made up with either a queen or two twins.
reviews.title: Charming little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is also what I have come to expect - good coffee and light breakfast basics. I usually supplemented with a large fruit cup bought from the vendor around the corner for 2euro.
reviews.title: Great location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this location in Venice. The hotel was easy to find in a quiet square but right around the corner from St Marks Square. The room was a good size with a large window overlooking a small piazza. It was clean and bright. The breakfast was good, with made to order Cappucino and assorted pastries and yogurt. The breakfast room was very small, but if the weather had been warmer there were tables set up outside as well. Shower and water pressure were very good. I would recommend this hotel for its location.
reviews.title: Lovely, quiet and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Venice is expensive so you’d want to stay somewhere that helps you maximize your probably short stay.
reviews.title: Great location 5 mins from St Mark’s

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa Querini’s just a 5 minute walk away from St Mark’s. This made it very convenient for quick walks to St Mark’s to take in the sights at night. The vaporetto stop is nearby and the rest of Venice, Murano and Burano are a hop away. There is decent food nearby (ask the front desk for recommendations) and the front desk is more than helpful, speaking good English.
reviews.title: Nice and clean, but not luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable enough though they could be a little larger. TV has English channels (BBC was a godsend), safe. Shower stall might be a slight squeeze for some. No lift but it was easy getting up the steps even with heavy luggage.
reviews.title: Lovely little B&B within the many hidden side streets of Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good breakfast of bread, cereal and yoghurt.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay
